multiple_choice.question: She ___ to school every day because she wants to learn.
multiple_choice.explanation: Third person singular uses 'goes' in present simple.
multiple_choice.clue: Think about third person singular form.

multiple_choice.question: Right now, I ___ very happy about my test results.
Look! They ___ eating lunch at the cafeteria.
My uncle ___ a doctor who works at the city hospital.
We ___ playing soccer in the park when it started raining.
The cat ___ on the mat because it's tired after playing.
You ___ my best friend, and I trust you completely.
It ___ raining outside, so we should bring umbrellas.
My friends ___ coming over to study for the exam tonight.
The book ___ interesting because it has many pictures.
Dogs ___ loyal animals that protect their owners.
She ___ singing a song while she cooks dinner.
We ___ going to the park after we finish our homework.
The sun ___ shining brightly in the summer sky.
The birds ___ flying in the sky looking for food.
There are many children in the playground. What is the plural of 'child'?
Yesterday, I ate a lot of food. What is the past tense of 'eat'?
When we talk about someone without using their name, we use a ___. For example: 'She is tall.'
Comparing two things, 'This apple is bigger than that one.' What is the comparative of 'big'?
multiple_choice.explanation: Add -er for comparative of one-syllable adjectives.

multiple_choice.question: Among three or more things, 'This is the ___ apple of all.' What is the superlative of 'small'?
multiple_choice.explanation: Add -est for superlative of one-syllable adjectives.

multiple_choice.question: In the sentence 'The book is on the table,' the word 'on' is a ___
multiple_choice.explanation: A preposition shows position or direction.

fill_blank.question: You ___ tall just like your father. (present simple)
Right now, it ___ raining heavily outside. (present continuous)
Look at her! She ___ singing a beautiful song. (present continuous)
Right now, I ___ eating dinner with my family. (present continuous)
They ___ running very fast in the race. (present continuous)
He ___ sleeping in his room right now. (present continuous)

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'She have two cats at home.'
Identify the error in: 'I goed to the park yesterday.'
Identify the error in: 'They plays football every weekend.'
Identify the error in: 'He do his homework every day.'
Identify the error in: 'We was very happy about the news.'
Identify the error in: 'She goed home after school.'
Identify the error in: 'I has a beautiful new bike.'

sentence_completion.question: Complete: The sun is ___ the sky.
Complete: The bird is perched ___ the tree outside our window.
Complete: The car is parked ___ the garage right now.
sentence_completion.explanation: 'In' shows location inside an enclosed space.

sentence_completion.question: Complete: The boy is standing ___ the door, waiting for his friend.
sentence_completion.explanation: 'At' shows a specific point or location.

sentence_completion.question: Complete: The girl is playing ___ the park near her house.
Complete: The pen is lying ___ the desk where I left it.
Complete: The dog is playing ___ the yard with its owner.
sentence_completion.explanation: 'In' shows location in an enclosed area.

multiple_choice.question: Comparing two friends, 'My sister is ___ than me at math.'
multiple_choice.clue: Compare two things → use comparative (-er or 'more')

multiple_choice.question: Last summer, I ___ to the beach with my family.
Among all the runners, John ran the ___ in the marathon.
multiple_choice.explanation: Superlative form compares three or more things.

multiple_choice.question: I have ___ the book you recommended. (past participle)
By dinner time, they ___ already ___ dinner. (present perfect)
Tomorrow, I ___ at the office by 9 AM.
The house ___ by the construction team last year. (passive voice)
___ rich, I would buy a big house. (second conditional)
multiple_choice.clue: Second conditional uses 'were' for unreal present

multiple_choice.question: I enjoy ___ in the morning because it clears my mind. (gerund)
multiple_choice.explanation: Gerund is verb + -ing used as noun.

multiple_choice.question: I want ___ to the concert tonight. (infinitive)
While I ___ TV, the phone rang. (past continuous)
By next month, I ___ this project. (future perfect)
multiple_choice.explanation: Future perfect: will have + past participle.

multiple_choice.question: The teacher suggested that he ___ more careful in his work. (subjunctive)
multiple_choice.explanation: Subjunctive uses base form after suggestions.

multiple_choice.question: He said, 'I am tired.' In reported speech:
options: He said that he was tired.
multiple_choice.answer: He said that he was tired.

multiple_choice.question: I had my car ___ at the mechanic yesterday. (causative)
Don't ___ hope when things get difficult. (phrasal verb)
multiple_choice.explanation: 'Give up' means to quit or stop trying.

multiple_choice.question: You ___ study harder if you want to pass the exam. (modal verb)
The man ___ lives next door is very friendly. (relative pronoun)
She gave ___ the book she borrowed from the library. (indirect object)
multiple_choice.explanation: Indirect object receives the direct object.

multiple_choice.question: ___ the dinner, we watched a movie. (participle)
My brother, ___ John, is a doctor. (appositive)
multiple_choice.explanation: Appositive renames or explains a noun.

multiple_choice.question: Unfortunately, my grandfather ___ last year. (idiom)
multiple_choice.explanation: 'Kick the bucket' is an idiom meaning 'to die'.

multiple_choice.question: The opposite of 'big' is ___
Another word for 'happy' is ___
A word similar in meaning to 'big' is ___
The opposite of 'happy' is ___
Another word for 'small' is ___

fill_blank.question: She is much ___ than her sister at playing piano.
fill_blank.explanation: Comparative form: add -er to one-syllable adjectives.

fill_blank.question: ___ I were you, I would apologize for being late.
They have been waiting here ___ two hours now.
She has already ___ the book you lent her.
We have ___ dinner, so we're not hungry.
I will ___ happy when I hear the good news.
The cake ___ by my mother every birthday. (passive)
If she ___ here now, she would help us.
He enjoys ___ long walks in the morning.
I want ___ home early today, please.
She ___ singing when I walked into the room.
By next year, I ___ my university degree.
fill_blank.explanation: Future perfect: will have + past participle.

fill_blank.question: I recommend that he ___ the job opportunity.
She told me that she ___ very happy about her results.
I will ___ my hair cut next Saturday.
fill_blank.explanation: Causative: will have + object + past participle.

fill_blank.question: Don't ___ hope; things will get better.
fill_blank.explanation: Phrasal verb 'give up' means to quit.

fill_blank.question: You ___ eat more vegetables for better health.
This is the house ___ I grew up as a child.
He gave ___ the money for the gift.
___ all the work finished, she went home.
Paris, ___ capital of France, is called the City of Light.
The old man ___ the bucket last night. (idiom: died)
She is very ___ about her upcoming birthday party.
The room is quite ___ compared to the main hall.
___ shall not perish from this world. (famous quote)
Live simply so that others may ___ simply. (Gandhi quote)
fill_blank.explanation: Chiasmus: live simply so others may live.

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'He don't like apples because they're sour.'
Identify the error in: 'She have a new car that she bought yesterday.'
Identify the error in: 'I have saw that movie three times.'
Identify the error in: 'She has went to the market already.'
Identify the error in: 'He will goes to school tomorrow morning.'
Identify the error in: 'The letter was wrote by the famous author.'
Identify the error in: 'If he comes, I will go to the party.'
error_identification.explanation: First conditional is correct for real future.

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'He decided to study medicine at university.'
Identify the error in: 'He was eat dinner when the guests arrived.'
Identify the error in: 'She will have finish the report by Friday.'
error_identification.clue: Will have finished, not will have finish

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'It's necessary that he comes on time.'
error_identification.clue: That he come, not that he comes

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'He said that he is very tired after work.'
error_identification.clue: Said he was, not said he is

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'She got her car repair at the garage.'
error_identification.clue: Got car repaired, not got car repair

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'He looked up the word in the dictionary.'
Identify the error in: 'He can sings very well at the concert.'
Identify the error in: 'The book which I read was very interesting.'
Identify the error in: 'She told I the story about her childhood.'
Identify the error in: 'Eating dinner, he watched TV shows.'
Identify the error in: 'He is a teacher, which is a noble profession.'
Identify the error in: 'She spilled the beans about the surprise party.'
Identify the error in: 'He is very glad about his achievement.'
Identify the error in: 'It is tiny compared to the elephant.'
Identify the error in: 'To be or not to be, that is the question.'
error_identification.explanation: This is correct from Shakespeare's Hamlet.

error_identification.question: Identify the error in: 'She sells seashells by the seashore.'

sentence_completion.question: Complete: I have been waiting ___ an hour for the bus.
Complete: He is very good ___ math and science.
Complete: He is very interested ___ learning new languages.
Complete: They are very afraid ___ spiders and snakes.
Complete: She is very famous ___ her beautiful paintings.
Complete: He is very responsible ___ completing his assignments on time.
Complete: We are looking ___ our keys everywhere.
Complete: She is very bad ___ cooking, so she orders food.
Complete: They agreed ___ the plan proposed by the manager.
Complete: I am tired ___ working overtime every day.
Complete: He is very capable ___ handling difficult situations.
Complete: She apologized ___ being late to the meeting.
Complete: I am very excited ___ the concert next week.
Complete: He succeeded ___ his efforts after many years of hard work.
Complete: She is allergic ___ nuts and dairy products.
Complete: We are waiting ___ the bus at the bus stop.
Complete: He is addicted ___ coffee and drinks it every day.
Complete: She complained ___ the noise from the construction.
Complete: They arrived ___ the station just in time for the train.
Complete: He depends ___ his parents for financial support.
Complete: She is famous ___ her contributions to science.
Complete: We are looking forward ___ the weekend.
sentence_completion.explanation: 'Look forward to' is the correct phrase.

sentence_completion.question: Complete: He is married ___ his work and spends long hours at the office.
Complete: She apologized ___ her mistake in the report.
Complete: They are responsible ___ the success of the project.

multiple_choice.question: By the time she arrived at the party, he ___ already ___ home.
multiple_choice.explanation: Past perfect for action completed before another past action.

multiple_choice.question: Identify the error: 'If I was you, I would study harder for the exam.'
multiple_choice.explanation: Subjunctive 'were' instead of 'was' for unreal conditions.

multiple_choice.question: She would have ___ the opportunity if she had known about it.
He ___ the book before the movie adaptation came out.
multiple_choice.explanation: Past perfect for action before another past action.

multiple_choice.question: They ___ to the party if they had received the invitation.
If he ___ harder, he would have passed the difficult exam.
multiple_choice.explanation: Third conditional: had studied + would have passed.

multiple_choice.question: She wishes she ___ the answer to that difficult question.
multiple_choice.explanation: Wish + past subjunctive for unreal present.

multiple_choice.question: By next year, I ___ here for ten years.
multiple_choice.explanation: Future perfect for action completed before future time.

multiple_choice.question: He acted as if he ___ the owner of the company.
I would rather you ___ smoking for your health.
It's high time we ___ the meeting and make a decision.
She suggested that he ___ early to avoid traffic.
If only I ___ what to do in this situation.
They demanded that the rules ___ changed immediately.
He talks as though he ___ everything about science.
___ I known about the problem, I would have helped you.
multiple_choice.clue: Had I known = If I had known

multiple_choice.question: She behaves as if she ___ the richest person in town.
It's essential that she ___ on time for the important meeting.
If I ___ you, I would apologize for my mistake.
He spoke as if he ___ the president of the company.
I wish I ___ taller so I could play basketball.
multiple_choice.explanation: 'Wish' takes past subjunctive for unreal present.

multiple_choice.question: ___ I rich, I would travel around the world.
multiple_choice.clue: Were I rich = If I were rich

multiple_choice.question: She insisted that he ___ present at the ceremony.
If only she ___ here now to help us with the problem.
He recommended that we ___ early to catch the flight.
He behaves as if he ___ the correct answer all along.

fill_blank.question: If I ___ you, I would study much harder for exams.
She wishes she ___ taller to join the basketball team.
If only I ___ the lottery jackpot last week.
He acts as if he ___ everything about this subject.
I would rather you ___ now instead of waiting.
It's time we ___ this project and present our findings.
She suggested that he ___ his job and find a better one.
If I had known about the traffic, I ___ you earlier.
fill_blank.explanation: Third conditional: would have + past participle.

fill_blank.question: He behaves as if he ___ the boss of this company.
I wish I ___ young again to relive my childhood.
___ I you, I would take this great opportunity.
She demanded that the report ___ submitted by Friday.
If only he ___ on time for once in his life.
He spoke as though he ___ the expert in this field.
It's essential that she ___ the meeting tomorrow.
I would have come to the party if I ___ invited properly.
She wishes she ___ the answer when she had the chance.
If I ___ president, I would make many changes.
He insisted that we ___ quiet during the examination.
I wish I ___ there to see the beautiful sunset.
___ she here, she would definitely help us solve this.
They recommended that he ___ professional help immediately.
If only I ___ what to say in this difficult moment.
He talks as if he ___ the secrets of the universe.
It's high time you ___ your room and organized your things.
If I had studied harder, I ___ the exam easily.
fill_blank.explanation: Third conditional: would have + past participle.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'She don't like apples because they're too sour.'
sentence_completion.answer: She doesn't like apples because they're too sour.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He go to school every day and he like math class.'
sentence_completion.answer: He goes to school every day and he likes math class.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'I have eat dinner already so I'm not hungry.'
sentence_completion.answer: I have eaten dinner already so I'm not hungry.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'She has went home because she felt sick.'
sentence_completion.answer: She has gone home because she felt sick.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He will goes to the office tomorrow morning.'
sentence_completion.answer: He will go to the office tomorrow morning.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'The letter was wrote by my grandfather in 1950.'
sentence_completion.answer: The letter was written by my grandfather in 1950.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'If he come to the party, I will be very happy.'
sentence_completion.answer: If he comes to the party, I will be very happy.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He decided study medicine at the university.'
sentence_completion.answer: He decided to study medicine at the university.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He was eat dinner when the guests arrived unexpectedly.'
sentence_completion.answer: He was eating dinner when the guests arrived unexpectedly.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'She will have finish the project by next week.'
sentence_completion.answer: She will have finished the project by next week.
sentence_completion.explanation: Future perfect: will have + past participle.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'It's necessary he come to the meeting on time.'
sentence_completion.answer: It's necessary that he come to the meeting on time.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He said that he is very tired after the long journey.'
sentence_completion.answer: He said that he was very tired after the long journey.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'She got her car repair at the expensive garage.'
sentence_completion.answer: She got her car repaired at the expensive garage.

sentence_completion.question: Identify: 'He looked up the word in the dictionary.'
sentence_completion.explanation: 'Look up' is correct phrasal verb meaning to search in dictionary.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He can sings beautifully at the karaoke bar.'
sentence_completion.answer: He can sing beautifully at the karaoke bar.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'The book I read last summer was very interesting.'
sentence_completion.answer: The book that I read last summer was very interesting.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'She told I the most amazing story about her travels.'
sentence_completion.answer: She told me the most amazing story about her travels.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'Eat dinner, he watched his favorite TV show.'
sentence_completion.answer: Having eaten dinner, he watched his favorite TV show.

sentence_completion.question: Correct: 'He is a teacher, interesting and very knowledgeable.'
sentence_completion.answer: He is a teacher, which is interesting and very knowledgeable.

sentence_completion.question: Identify: 'She spilled the beans about the surprise party.'
sentence_completion.explanation: 'Spill the beans' is idiom meaning to reveal a secret.

sentence_completion.question: Identify: 'He is very glad about his achievement.'
Identify: 'It is tiny compared to the elephant.'
Identify: 'To be or not to be, that is the question.'
Identify: 'She sells seashells by the seashore.'
sentence_completion.explanation: This is a famous tongue twister with alliteration.

sentence_completion.question: Complete: 'Live simply so that others may ___ simply.' (Gandhi quote)
sentence_completion.explanation: Chiasmus: live simply so others may live simply.
